website_summaries.verdict: While pricey, this antifreeze works well with a wide range of vehicles and offers a less toxic formula than traditional antifreeze.
pros: Uses propylene glycol as opposed to ethylene glycol, making it less toxic than other antifreezes
Wide range of uses, from motorcycles and high-performance cars to street vehicles
cons: Costs nearly twice the price of other antifreezes

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed. I actually averaged 3-5 degrees hotter than standard ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Engine Ice for my 2016 Rzr S 900. Flushed the system and added the Ice. Ran it all weekend at Burning Rock, West Virginia. I was very disappointed. I actually averaged 3-5 degrees hotter than standard coolant. My son has an identical Rzr S 900. He consistently ran cooler than I did with only standard coolant. In my experience, the "the ten degrees cooler" with Engine Ice is a sham.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Benson

customer_reviews.title: This product certainly lives up to its name...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coolant based off a YouTube recommendations, and I must say without any reservation after riding my Goldwing over 5000 miles in the past 10 days, carrying a full load to include 2 passengers, and with desert temperatures reaching upwards of 111 degrees the temperature gauge never came close to overheating; in fact it was averaging the same temperatures I had observed in 80 degree weather. This is a product I will continue to use as long as I can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great For A Hot Street Bike
customer_reviews.text: While it may not be allowed at most tracks, this is a good alternative for antifreeze on the street. Just be sure to keep your system clean. I recommend a vinegar and distilled water flush at least once a year to prevent any build up of the waxy additive in this. For the track, only distilled water with some water wetter will do.
customer_reviews.author: StrifeWolfe

customer_reviews.title: Works about as well as antifreeze.
customer_reviews.text: 2013 Kawasaki Ninja ZX14R. I ordered this because ZX14's tend to run hot (floating around 200 - 207 degrees F) and the fan constantly kicks on. I have noticed, after changing the coolant out for Engine Ice, that it has hit 210 and 212 degrees F on more than one occasion. So, I am not seeing a reduction in operating temperature as claimed. Shipping was quick. Price per performance seems to be lacking. Maybe I will try distilled water + Water Wetter next time.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W.

customer_reviews.title: 2016 KTM Duke 390 Coolant Change, WOW
customer_reviews.text: Flushed my rad yesterday and switched from yucky, glow in the dark stuff to Engine Ice. Took her out for a quick rip, noticeable difference in cooling. Normally, the KTM Dukes run 2 bars from the top of the temp gauge. Mine was running 3 bars from the top with the Engine Ice, and then when I was revving her up a bit, would hit 2 bars before max temp, fan came on but only for a very short time before turning off again. This is AMAZING!!!! Normally the fan runs way longer and sooner. This stuff definitely works and I love that it is non-toxic!!!
customer_reviews.author: nzbeezy

customer_reviews.title: Great motorcycle coolant.
customer_reviews.text: Good coolant, seems to keep my engine running cooler overall. And its biodegradable!! Which is great because oh boy changing your coolant is a messy endeavor and this way you don't have to premix, or worry about killing everything in a five foot radius (including skin and shoes) with that radioactive green stuff. One note, this is only 1/2 gallon, so if your bike or car needs more than that make sure to get two.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Bell

customer_reviews.title: It's O.K.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this antifreeze for my 2007 Honda CRF 450 because it said it would keep my engine cooler. I've done 2 races with this antifreeze and both times the bike has over heated and I lost antifreeze. I race desert and can't afford to overheat and break down in the middle of the desert. After I use the rest of it I'm going to switch to something else. It works o.k. but the other antifreeze worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Indeed lowers the engine temperature
customer_reviews.text: I Have a 2016 Yamaha R6. It would usually reach 190-210 F while riding after 10-15 mins. After changing the OEM coolant to engine ice, I see the temperature between 167-171 F. Yet to see if the mid-summer temperature affect the current range. So far..so good. Like the fact that its environmentally not harmful as other products.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product - screaming fast delivery !!
customer_reviews.text: 2007 CanAm Renegade 800. Shes a screamer. Time to change all fluids. Thought I'd give this a shot. With temp gun in hand, I'm running 15 degrees cooler measured at radiator. For me the price does not matter, it is all about performance. This magic performs, period. For a 3rd party vendor I must admit, twice now they got it to me faster than most Prime in stock items. Great seller. Great product. Great adventures ahead. Roll on folks 😎😎😎
customer_reviews.author: SLED

customer_reviews.title: 2008-2016 R6 Yamaha, No change in temperature.
customer_reviews.text: You get 2 stars. I was able to properly flush my coolant on my bike. There is no change in temperature. My fans are still kicking in often. Overflowed in cold weather last year and this year. Is this water? 2012 R6 owner. Properly flushed I have the videos. Sportsbikes owner DO NOT USE. Leaning over while it’s leaking was dangerous. This product is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: NinaT

customer_reviews.title: Works for zx7r pretty well
customer_reviews.text: So I got engine ice out of impulse. If you have a zx7r these big girls give off heatttttt. I had normal coolent that green stuff. Let's paint a picture. Before engine ice temp gauge would hover over the 2/4 bar with it hovers under. Maybe because I did proper flush and burping or just ice is working. Normally I get off highway take back roads and use to hit halfway mark on gauge and fan kicks on once gone after 3 miles back roads. Now its just above the 1/4 mark and fan doesnt kick on once home. So it's either proper flush or engine ice I can't compare since this Is first flush since I've owned bike.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have used Engine Ice in several motorcycles for street and track use and it performs as advertised. I seen an average temperature decrease of 11 degrees F for street use and 8 degree F for track use. I will continue to buy this product and use it.
customer_reviews.author: James Layman

customer_reviews.title: Engine ice is the way to go.
customer_reviews.text: This coolant really works. At first I was sceptical about whether it would actually work. The temperature of my motorcycle would hit 200°f. After flushing the radiator fluid and putting in the engine ice the engine temperature is 185°f to 190°f. That's a huge difference in temperature.
customer_reviews.author: DEW

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my cooling issues
customer_reviews.text: I have 2x older Polaris ATVs, 500cc Sportsman. I was getting overheats on both units. Replaced everything, hoses, waterpump, thermo switch, thermostat and indicator light, no change. Drain green stuff, flush with distilled water, flush with engine ice, refill with engine ice. Problems solved on both units.
customer_reviews.author: A. Franke

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Engine Ice for my 2010 Kawi Z1000. Seems to work great. Does seem to be a bit cooler than the coolant that came out. The bike has no temp guage so I have no numbers but the bike used to get really hot at stops but it seems to be a tad better now. A big 1000cc inline 4 will never be a particularly cool running engine though.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: It works as it was described.
customer_reviews.text: I use this coolant in a Vulcan s. It seems to work just as good as ethylene glycol coolant The simple fact it’s nontoxic is why I got it I don’t really know if the rest of it’s marketing fap is true or not. there is no where around me to dispose of the coolant with ethylene glycol. So I bought this so I can just throw it in my yard when it’s depleted.
customer_reviews.author: sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Costs more but works.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely helps my vmax 1200 run cooler. I flushed my rad with distilled water and white vinegar 50/50 mix (run for a few minutes to circulate). Then let cool down, drained and flushed with straight distilled water -recirculated to temp again. Drained and used a little more than 1 of the Engine Ice containers.
customer_reviews.author: White Feather

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. My motorcycle definitely runs cooler. While riding the other day the heat index was 99, my motorcycle stayed around 173 degrees, it also takes longer to get hot when i stop at a red light. Compare to my cousins bike he's running 10+ degrees hotter than I am. Sitting at a red light he was at 210 I was at 190 when we pulled away from the light.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snake oil
customer_reviews.text: It dont run engine cooler. I dont know how people are saying that it runs engine cooler, science says otherwise. I wish I had done my research of ethanol vs propylene glycol before buying this product
customer_reviews.author: Fazal Abbas

customer_reviews.title: Stays a bit cooler than whatever I had in originally.
customer_reviews.text: 2017 FZ07, the 0.5 gal bottle was more than enough for the bike. I had a bit left over, maybe enough to top off the rad for a year or so depending on how much it boils off. Temps weren't amazingly different, but maybe 10F lower or so. Haven't really paid close attention to it - swapped the fluids out in the first place because I was running low.
customer_reviews.author: Yes

customer_reviews.title: Firstly it environmentally friendly and biodegradable which is cool. It is pretty much just water wetter with ...
customer_reviews.text: Engine ice is the GOAT. Firstly it environmentally friendly and biodegradable which is cool. It is pretty much just water wetter with additives, so it wont freeze like water and water wetter would. It will keep your temps down over conventional antifreeze. Fact. Worth paying the premiums since you don't really need to buy it regularly like oil and since it is premixed you just dump it straight in.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler2 Sims

customer_reviews.title: Expensive
customer_reviews.text: Made absolutely no difference in operating temperature. Might as well I've added colored water. Nothing more than a waste of $150 for me
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Helped significantly for 1700 Kawasaki Voyager
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews was skeptic but have a 18 1700 voyager. Runs HOT from the factory. I’m in Myrtle beach 90+ every day I summer. Was just about on red every time. The pics are in traffic and highway speeds. Significantly improved heat in my situation. I think bad reviews may be from bikes people think are hot but 35 years of riding this bike HOT.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle coolant
customer_reviews.text: Just what my motorcycle needed for the radiator. I know you can buy car stuff that doesn't have silicate, but would rather use something geared more for motorcycle then a car. Used it for 05' Kawasaki Ninja EX250. Then bought this again in 03/16 for 04' Suzuki Sv650s.
customer_reviews.author: Erik F.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, non toxic, biodegradable.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and bonus is the fluid is non toxic and biodegradable. Got sprayed directly in the face and eyes with coolant whilst changing radiator hoses when a lower popped off and flung coolant. Did not burn, did not irritate, as i made my way to the other end of the building to a sink to flush out my eyes. Luckily this happened with non toxic engine ice, and not something caustic while out in the desert.
customer_reviews.author: Manolo al Sol

customer_reviews.title: great for hot days
customer_reviews.text: Well after flushing my coolant system on my 2018 gsxr 750 I put engine ice in and I definitely see a difference it clearly takes longer to get above 190 degrees usually goes to 187 then drops back down a few times before getting hot enough for the fan to come on
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: my zx6r has not hit 230 degrees yet since my engine ice has been installed and i put 100 miles on it. it used to hit 230 on a hot day now i max at 221 degrees. and im in florida... 4 stars only because they should add more to the jug, 1.89 liters aint enough for the price but cool product
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Ninja zx12r problem solved!
customer_reviews.text: The fastest production motorcycle ever made, the 2000 Kawasaki Ninja zx12r, runs hot from the factory. I flushed the system and added 100% engine ice and it is running much cooler. I also have a Dynojet autotune and the trim values have changed because the engine is running cooler. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Ninja ZX12R

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: From countless hours of research, coolant has the same basic properties. My guess is, “ATV specific” coolant like other fluids are marked up because they can. You can verify with a mechanic but I’m willing to be, any generic coolant would suffice.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Stay cool
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my Hayabusa. It made a great difference in the temperature rising while idling in traffic. I also use it in my 2013 Kawasaki Concours14. I drained all the old antifreeze out and flushed the system with distilled water (very important). Then filled it with Engine ice and I can see a difference in temps but not as much as I did on my Hayabusa. It is still worth the money and is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: The Rebel

customer_reviews.title: Slightly overrated
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is expensive especially for the small amount you get for the price. It also poors out sloppy even when using a funnel. Don't get me wrong, it does the job on keeping my engine cool but I wasn't even able to top off my R6 with one bottle and I'm not about to pay for an entire second bottle just to fill another cup or so of coolant.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Landfair

customer_reviews.title: Reduced operating temp 10* lower than just a water wetting agent
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem 2010 Spyder which is prone to heat issues. Have noticed improvement in around 10* in the worst of days & 25* on a normal day. I may have to go for an oil replacement ?
customer_reviews.author: J. French Rennier

customer_reviews.title: Cooler S1000rr
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who knows anything about the BMW S1000rr knows it gets very hot. Engine Ice makes a noticeable difference, and a cooler engine is a stronger engine....which is always a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hedges

customer_reviews.title: best stuff you can put in your bike
customer_reviews.text: this stuff is pretty good i dont see why you would put anything else in your bike. It definitely runs about 10 degrees cooler as they claim maybe not right on the dot but pretty close and it still has antifreeze properties so you dont have to worry about it in the winter as you do with water wetter for instance i recommend this to anybody that lives in a hot area and rides a sport bike
customer_reviews.author: Nick636n8r

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to name
customer_reviews.text: I don't keep my soda in my lunch box anymore, instead I tape them to my radiator; that's how cool this stuff keeps your engine
customer_reviews.author: Jordan P

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you want the best!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised simply the Best coolant there is on the market
customer_reviews.author: Reese Basile

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t make Sense. Paying so much for Coolant.
customer_reviews.text: The price is just ridiculous. $25 for Half Gallon. It’s $50 to get coolant in your bike. DO SOME RESEARCH there’s great kids perfect for Motorcycles and Aluminum motors.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Felix

customer_reviews.title: My hayabusa loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: Bike definitely running cooler in this texas heat!!! Im less stressed in town at red lites and traffic!!
customer_reviews.author: John m.

customer_reviews.title: Holly cow this stuff works
customer_reviews.text: Honestly was getting a constant 6 degrees cooler running supersport bike. The cool thing is how quickly the bike would cool down like when sitting in traffic and then start moving. This is amazing stuff. I learned you can't runs these on Ducatis. So check before chaning your coolent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked great, and it is cheaper by far than going to a motorcycle shop in purchasing it I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: AtheyMts

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. It completely boiled out in 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my 1999 Polaris sportsman 500 and it boiled out completely within 20 minutes of riding. I've never had any issues at all and my quad is kept in tip top shape. I will not be purchasing this again and I wanting to get a refund for this product and I have no issue sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Nature

customer_reviews.title: Much better.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my street bike. I think it runs much cooler. I flushed my old fluid out with water a few times and then filled with this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Only coolant I will run
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. Not toxic and helps all my off-road stuff rum great. I have converted everything over to engine ice so I don’t run anything other than this Will continue to buy
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Idk...
customer_reviews.text: Changed the radiator fluid on my R6 with this. I haven't noticed a massive change in temperature drop. But at least I know the fluid has been changed.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal F

customer_reviews.title: actually works
customer_reviews.text: when ever I use this product, it takes 20% longer for engine to warm up... it must cool better than ethylene glycol
customer_reviews.author: this book was very intresting. I couldn't put it down. it had me on the edge of my seat.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Haven't really had a chance to tested properly. But my friends run this product and absolutely love it
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be good coolant
customer_reviews.text: I use this coolant in my yz450fx. for some reason I just continue to buy this product because it cost more than all the others so it makes me think it's better. Somebody let me know if this is really a good product
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Product  !
customer_reviews.text: GREAT Coolant , Flush out my 2016 Can Am outlander 1000R and added Engine ice , keeps it cooler for sure !
customer_reviews.author: Stevo

customer_reviews.title: Big difference
customer_reviews.text: Way better than what I expected. My bike hasn’t spilled at all through the over flow when it used to often with other coolants.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: I have a 383 Stroker which loves to run hot and as soon as I replaced the coolant and took it for a spin it was running too cool
customer_reviews.text: Extremely impressed!!! I have a 383 Stroker which loves to run hot and as soon as I replaced the coolant and took it for a spin it was running too cool!!! running approx. 170 to 180 F!!!! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Comes with 3, I have 2 in storage and 1 in bike
customer_reviews.text: Love the stuff, my bike runs so much cooler which is especially important in the summer!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel S Saslafsky

customer_reviews.title: Keep your bike cool
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical About the reviews but they are 100% correct. This antifreeze makes your bike run cooler and more efficiently. Great value thank you
customer_reviews.author: eea887

customer_reviews.title: perfect for v-twins
customer_reviews.text: this stuff is so much better than regular ol coolant. better for the environment as well
customer_reviews.author: Shaun P Granato

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: this is great especially if you ride your bike to the max!! It will keep it cool for a lot longer time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: If you ask around this is the only stuff to put in your bike! Everybody gives it super high ratings!
customer_reviews.author: WOODY

customer_reviews.title: He tells me it run GREAT with a 10 to 15 degrees cooler then normal ...
customer_reviews.text: I son ride a 20012 Kawasaki Ninja ZX6R. He tells me it run GREAT with a 10 to 15 degrees cooler then normal operating standards. I recommend this to anyone who worries about over heating. Good Luck...P.S. It works as soon as you put it in. It took a long while to get bike up to normal temp...
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Keep it cool
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what to say aside from, it keeps the engine cool and running smooth. I have not had any issues with the product as it works as advertised. Comes at a good price point and was exactly as one would expect. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work.
customer_reviews.text: It works in my atv. Don’t really know what else to say. I can’t tell any difference.
customer_reviews.author: joey lsell

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Had a low coolant possible overheating issue, after about 3 flushes and a refill with this stuff, and a new cap....no more overheating problem.
customer_reviews.author: John Nortesano Jr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! I have it in my 4wheeler and my buddy has the same wheeler as me and mine consistently runs 40 degrees cooler than his. Will definitely be running this in all my stuff from here on.
customer_reviews.author: barbara Lynn Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Constant temperatures work best
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product to help keep high temperatures a little lower, seems to be doing as advertised.. Cool, literally cool!!!
customer_reviews.author: tmil

customer_reviews.title: Keep my bike running cool even in stop and go traffic
customer_reviews.text: I tried 4 different coolants and got the most significant result with engine ice. Keep my bike running cool even in stop and go traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H.

customer_reviews.title: Best coolant you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love engine ice! Run it in all my bikes. My Honda xr650r runs over 20 degrees cooler with this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: cdcook22

customer_reviews.title: Polaris Outlaw 525 too hot!
customer_reviews.text: My 2008 Outlaw, was way over heating here in hell aka Texas. Designed in Austria, not in hell, these motors get hot, esy when the radiator fins are covered in cement! This blue liquid is the best I've tried, better than the pink redline water wetter. Get it, get cool.
customer_reviews.author: Three D

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: keeps my 300 2 smoker from over heating in 100 degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: R.R

customer_reviews.title: Good price if you need this product.
customer_reviews.text: Good price if you need this product. Didn’t solve the overheating problem, but, it was specified.
customer_reviews.author: semi-retired

customer_reviews.title: Good item.
customer_reviews.text: Not a cheap product but works good. The container is small so you may need two.
customer_reviews.author: F. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my engine cool I do both fast and slow riding no sign of over heating
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace the fluid in my 2009 Harley Davidson Night Rod. So far I have not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: A C

customer_reviews.title: Good not bad
customer_reviews.text: Little bottle bit pricey but did stop my over heating problem a little for gsxr 600
customer_reviews.author: Danilo.7

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great! I'll never use anything other then engine ice in my bikes now!
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Very good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! Helps my R1 run alot cooler. Just make sure you flush the system really good(i flushed mine 6 times with distilled water).
customer_reviews.author: glen Howard

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended and is a good product if you intend to buy this product

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my bike!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my motorcycle.... My bike has never run better, especially in south Florida where I live....

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I rebuilt the whole cooling system so not sure if it was that or the coolant but the bike does not overheat.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my raptor 660
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff and the best price i have found on anything less than 5 gal.

customer_reviews.title: No temperature change
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t notice a temperature change on my 2001 Yamaha R6

customer_reviews.title: Higher boiling point is effective.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in my cooling system for many years and am happy with it.

customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to review a product I didn't receive I hear it's good I'll update review and rating when it gets to me

customer_reviews.title: IIccceeee!!!
customer_reviews.text: Blue is cool!! I'll see how it holds up in an AZ afternoon drive home. 04 CBR600RR, enough for everything needed to refill coolant.

customer_reviews.title: Sport Bike Track Time STT approved.Uses propylene glycol not Ethylene glycol.
customer_reviews.text: Let's find out. Racing next week. Sport Bike Track Time STT approved. Uses propylene glycol not Ethylene glycol. In 2008 YZF-R6 track bike.
customer_reviews.author: Go Pack Go

customer_reviews.title: Same as other brands.
customer_reviews.text: I pulled the trigger on this to see if what they claim is BS or not. Well it is. My bike runs at exactly the same temps as the coolant it came with. 2016 GSXR 600.
customer_reviews.author: ZeroFlow-FPV

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Engine ice is probably the best coolant for a four stroke dirtbike
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coolant for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: One of the best coolants for motorcycles. Keeps my heat monster cool.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kinney

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my 2005 Yamaha 600 R Thundercat. So far so good. The temperature is not too hot yet so we’ll see what it’s like in July and August.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Works good good price
customer_reviews.text: The three pack is a much better price than individually. We use it for our 4 wheelers.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect measure
customer_reviews.text: Yamaha R1. Fills the whole cooling system to the rim. Maybe had to add 1-2 drops of Distilled water to complete the fill. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: BachaRod

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coolant. I use it in all our water-cooled bikes now. glad there's no need to measure and mix, and bikes run nice and cool!

customer_reviews.title: Enough for two coolant changes for 2016 - S1000RR
customer_reviews.text: it seems fine, used it on S1000rr. it is enough for two coolant changes, I haven't felt the difference in cooling but it is environmentally friendly.

customer_reviews.title: Proven greatness
customer_reviews.text: Changed over both my dirtbike and atv to engine ice and so far so good!

customer_reviews.title: I replaced my stock AF with this, my bike(KTM ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my stock AF with this,my bike(KTM 390 duke) has always run hot. I got this thinking it would help, I honestly haven't noticed a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the engine cool without the possibility of oily spills

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Can't really say that my bike ran cooler but I used this when I did a coolant flush and it worked fine. Would def buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Best coolant I know of
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten great performance since adding this coolant and love how water is not needed since it is already included.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works amazing in my Raptor 660 which would sometimes run hot ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works amazing in my Raptor 660 which would sometimes run hot but no since I switch to this product. Highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: Engine Ice has yet to fail me. love this stuff

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I run it on a Kawasaki Ninja Zx10r. While gliding through the streets of Florida I would say the bike runs 5-10 degrees cooler.
customer_reviews.author: James Armetta

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work
customer_reviews.text: Bought a radiator cap with a temp gauge to measure temp difference in bike. Seems to help about 6-10 degrees cooler running temp on my CRF450R racing dirtbike...
customer_reviews.author: Eddie M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done I used 1 full bottle to fill up my radiator

customer_reviews.title: The best cooling system for your motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: The best cooling system for your motorcycle, bar none! Definitely reduced the temps on my MV Agust Rivale.. And best part, its non toxic!
customer_reviews.author: Spike Spiegel

product_meta.title: Engine Ice TYDS008-02 High Performance Coolant, 0.5 gallon, 2 Pack
product_meta.description: Size:2-Pack (128 oz)Engine Ice Hi-Performance Coolant is biodegradable, phosphate free & non-toxic; typically reduces operating race temperatures and effectively keeping boil over temperatures to 256 Degree Fahrenheit or less and freeze-up protection to -26 Degree F. With an average reduction in operating temperatures of 10 Degree Fahrenheit - 20 Degree Fahrenheit Engine Ice is perfect for racing or street, motorcycle or auto, ATV or snow machine. Engine Ice Hi-Performance Coolant is legal in CCS and ASRA road racing and permitted at many tracks around the world. Engineered to keep your operating temperatures at optimum performance to not lose power through excess heat. Engine Ice is safe for aluminum and most all metals. Uses propylene glycol, which has been proven to eliminate water pump gasket and seal failures. It has also shown in high load, high stress conditions to reduce operating temperatures more than standard coolants.
